abstract: Dr Jean Lindenmann, co-discoverer of antiviral substance interferon, dies at age 90.
lead_paragraph: As a postdoctoral student working with Dr. Alick Isaacs in 1957, Dr. Lindenmann discovered interferon, the powerful antiviral substance used to treat some cancers, hepatitis C and multiple sclerosis.
snippet: As a postdoctoral student working with Dr. Alick Isaacs in 1957, Dr. Lindenmann discovered interferon, the powerful antiviral substance used to treat some cancers, hepatitis C and multiple sclerosis.

headline.main: Jean Lindenmann, Who Made Interferon His Life’s Work, Is Dead at 90
headline.print_headline: Jean Lindenmann, 90; Made Interferon His Life’s Work
